# gtfs2gps: Converting public transport data from GTFS format to GPS-like records

[![CRAN/METACRAN
Version](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/gtfs2gps)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=gtfs2gps).[![CRAN/METACRAN
Total
downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/grand-total/gtfs2gps?color=blue)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=gtfs2gps)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/ipeaGIT/gtfs2gps/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/ipeaGIT/gtfs2gps/actions)
[![Codecov test
coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/ipeaGIT/gtfs2gps/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/ipeaGIT/gtfs2gps?branch=master)
[![Paper](https://img.shields.io/badge/DOI-10.1007%2Fs10109--022--00400--x-blue)](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10109-022-00400-x)

**gtfs2gps** is an R package that converts public transportation data in
GTFS format to GPS-like records in a `data.frame`/`data.table`, which
can then be used in various applications such as running transport
simulations or scenario analyses.

The core function of the package takes a `GTFS.zip` file and
interpolates the space-time position of each vehicle in each trip
considering the network distance and average speed between stops. The
output is a `data.table` where each row represents the timestamp of each
vehicle at a given spatial resolution. The package also has some
functions to subset GTFS data in time and space and to convert both
representations to [simple
feature](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=sf) format. More information
about the methods used in the package can be found in this
[preprint](https://osf.io/preprints/socarxiv/qydr6/).

### Installation

Please install **gtfs2gps** package from CRAN to get the stable version.

``` r
install.packages("gtfs2gps")
library(gtfs2gps)
```

### Vignette

Please see our vignette:

- [gtfs2gps: Converting GTFS data to GPS
  format](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/articles/intro_to_gtfs2gps.html)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Credits ![ipea](reference/figures/ipea_logo.png)

The **gtfs2gps** package is developed by a team at the Institute for
Applied Economic Research (Ipea) with collaboration from the National
Institute for Space Research (INPE), both from Brazil. You can cite this
package as:

- Pereira, R. H. M., Andrade, P. R., & Vieira, J. P. B. (2022).
  Exploring the time geography of public transport networks with the
  gtfs2gps package. *Journal of Geographical Systems*.
  <https://doi.org/10.1007/s10109-022-00400-x>

# Package index

## All functions

- [`adjust_arrival_departure()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/adjust_arrival_departure.md)
  : Adjust the arrival and departure times of a GTFS data

- [`adjust_speed()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/adjust_speed.md)
  :

  Adjust the speeds of a gps-like table created with `gtfs2gps`

- [`append_height()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/append_height.md)
  : Add a column with height to GPS data

- [`filter_single_trip()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/filter_single_trip.md)
  : Filter GTFS trips in order to have one trip per shape_id

- [`filter_valid_stop_times()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/filter_valid_stop_times.md)
  : Filter GTFS data using valid stop times

- [`gps_as_sflinestring()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/gps_as_sflinestring.md)
  : Converts a GPS-like data.table to a LineString Simple Feature (sf)
  object

- [`gps_as_sfpoints()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/gps_as_sfpoints.md)
  : Convert GPS-like data.table to a Simple Feature points object

- [`gtfs2gps()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/gtfs2gps.md)
  : Convert GTFS to GPS-like data given a spatial resolution

- [`gtfs_shapes_as_sf()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/gtfs_shapes_as_sf.md)
  : Convert GTFS shapes to simple feature object

- [`gtfs_stops_as_sf()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/gtfs_stops_as_sf.md)
  : Convert GTFS stops to simple feature object

- [`read_gtfs()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/read_gtfs.md)
  : Read GTFS data into a list of data.tables

- [`remove_invalid()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/remove_invalid.md)
  : Remove invalid objects from GTFS data

- [`simplify_shapes()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/simplify_shapes.md)
  : Simplify shapes of a GTFS file

- [`test_gtfs_freq()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/test_gtfs_freq.md)
  : Test whether a GTFS feed is frequency based

- [`write_gtfs()`](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/reference/write_gtfs.md)
  : Write GTFS data into a zip file

  format](https://ipeagit.github.io/gtfs2gps/articles/intro_to_gtfs2gps.md):
